SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
ENABLEMENT SITES (MYTRAILHEAD)
Enablement Sites Rollout Guide

Get started with enablement sites (formerly myTrailhead) and deliver your company’s unique learning content through a branded experience powered by the Trailhead online learning platform.

NOTE Since February 2022, parts of the enablement site workflow have had a few label changes. We've updated some terminology in Trailmaker and in this help, but previous terminology can still appear in Salesforce, this help, and other resources such as Trailhead and Salesforce Knowledge. See Terminology Changes from myTrailhead to Enablement Sites.

People in multiple roles in your company collaborate to bring your enablement experience to life. Three personas in particular have critical roles: Salesforce admins, content creators, and release managers. They’re responsible for developing and implementing your company’s content strategy.

 1. Plan

Before you commit resources to building your company’s enablement experience, evaluate your requirements and plan your solution. Identify your learning audience, strategize on how your enablement experience extends your company’s brand, and gather the resources and people to make it happen.

CONTENT TYPE	TITLE	SALESFORCE ADMIN	CONTENT CREATOR	RELEASE MANAGER
	User Roles for an Enablement Site			
	Attend the Monthly myTrailhead Expert Coaching Webinar (Premier Support Plan required)			
	Enablement Site Basics			
	Example Use Cases for an Enablement Site			
 2. Set Up

When you’re ready to create your learning experience, implement your plan.

CONTENT TYPE	TITLE	SALESFORCE ADMIN	CONTENT CREATOR	RELEASE MANAGER
	Enablement Site Configuration			
	Set Up Your Enablement Site's Subdomain and First Content Collection			
	Authentication Providers for Your Enablement Site			
	Assign Permissions for Enablement Site Users			
	Brand Your Enablement Site			
	Manage Filters for Enablement Site Content			
	Segment Content for Specific Audiences with Content Permissions			
 3. Create

With your enablement site created and users established, it’s time to let your creative teams outline, draft, review, and polish the content for your audiences. When your content is finalized, writers can create the trails, modules, units, and quizzes in Trailmaker.

CONTENT TYPE	TITLE	SALESFORCE ADMIN	CONTENT CREATOR	RELEASE MANAGER
	Create Content Quickly with Content Templates			
	Using a Content Template			
	Writing for an Enablement Site			
	Trailmaker Content Basics			
	Create Content with the Trailmaker Content App			
 4. Publish

Bring your team’s enablement content to life and make it available for learners.

CONTENT TYPE	TITLE	SALESFORCE ADMIN	CONTENT CREATOR	RELEASE MANAGER
	Trailmaker Release Basics			
	Manage Releases with the Trailmaker Release App			
 5. Adopt

Expand your audiences and support learners who prefer or require other languages.

CONTENT TYPE	TITLE	SALESFORCE ADMIN	CONTENT CREATOR	RELEASE MANAGER

More Support and Resources

If you still have questions, check out these resources.

First, we recommend that you review the Ask the myTrailhead Expert webinar, which addresses many frequently asked questions.
Visit the Trailblazer Community, where you can post your own questions, share experiences, and learn best practices from other users.
If you still need help, submit a case with Salesforce Customer Support. For Product, select Other Salesforce. For Topic, select myTrailhead.
